title: Zefyr: A Thief's Melody (2025)
comments: - a fun 3d platformer bringing it back to the ps2 era
- gorgeous but a rather empty world
- boss fights were neat but very easy and cheeseable
- fun soundtrack

title: Psycho Patrol R (2025)
comments: - ville has done it again
- while obviously in very early stages, the game was very enjoyable to play and as always, the dialogue is peak
- countryside had horrible loading times and was just a big and empty area
- the only gripe i had was how the enemies don't care about los and how they instantly hone in on you, but a recent patch supposedly made changes to the aggro time

title: Cruelty Squad (2021)
comments: - its been so long since i played this but i do remember enjoying it a lot
- also a really fun speedrun game when played NG
- placeholder date, don't remember exactly when in 2022 i played it

title: Mafia (2002)
comments: - one of my all time favorites with some of the best soundtrack in video game history

title: Elden Ring (2022)
comments: - played base game on launch and dlc on launch
- sick level design and cool bosses
- dlc has one of my favorite souls' bosses ever
- invasions were sort of butchered which is a shame

title: Underrail (2015)
comments: - really cool setting and engaging story
- stealth was viable without being cheesy

title: A Hat in Time (2017)
comments: - a really fun 3d platformer with fun movement and tech
- fun speedrun as well

title: Days Gone (2019)
comments: - story while nothing out of the ordinary surprisingly kept me engaged and had some really cool moments
- typical fun zombie horde shooter

title: Pseudoregalia (2023)
comments: - a very fun old school platformer game
- movement was fun although a little clunky when it comes to wallruns and -jumps, probably just a skill issue
- cool level design and a fun final boss fight
